results.title: One past eight futures "The making of"
results.brief_description: This mini-documentary takes us behind the scenes of the ‘One past eight futures’ Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. The participants of this particular workshop are eight young indigenous people who are part of the Indigenous Youth Leadership program. They discuss their stories, their participation in the workshop and what they have gained from the experience. The results are a social and cultural snapshot of Australia’s Indigenous youth, through their stories, their ties to the past and, mostly, their hopes for the future.

results.title: One out of three is a fsihboat
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hard-hitting film suggesting that new attitudes and practices are needed in Canada’s fishing industry to protect the lives and property of those who work at sea. Accidents due to the unsafe condition of boats, bad habits of seamanship, fire or defects in safety equipment can be avoided. A ship safety inspector and instructors at New Brunswick’s School of Fisheries and Newfoundland’s College of Fisheries show where the roots of disaster can lie.

results.title: One out of every four: aid for expellees and refugees
results.brief_description: Discusses the problems created by the great influx of immigrants from East Germany and elsewhere - nearly fifteen million in number - who have come to West Germany since the war years.

results.title: One old man
results.brief_description: A gentle chronicle of an old man who approaches each day with a zest for the “miracle of being alive”. A film suitable for guidance, contemporary problems, geriatrics or philosophy.

results.title: One of thousands
results.creator_credit: Ralph Basson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.

results.title: One of them is Brett
results.creator_credit: Roger Graef and Derrick Knight and Partners
results.brief_description: The hardships, disappointments and joys of a thalidomide child living in a society of physically normal people. Brett Nielsen, a Sydney boy, born without arms, was taken to London for treatment. Tells of the personal sacrifices made by his parents, the obstacles they have faced and their efforts to accustom Brett to his situation wihtout indulging in self pity. Shows the fitting of artificial limbs and the activities in which these enable Brett to participate with normal children. Briefly looks at his future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Graef and Derrick Knight and Partners

results.title: One of them
results.creator_credit: Stewart Main, Peter Wells, Michele Fantl and Zee Films
results.brief_description: One of Them is the bittersweet story of two teenage boys growing up in New Zealand in the 1960s, trying to come to terms with being gay, or as they call it being “one of them”. Newcomers Cameron J. Watt and Ciaran Pennington both give a touching performance as Lemmy and Jamie, who are endearing in their angst-ridden confusion and cocky humour. Always on the outer, their ‘difference’ brings them closer together, (as well as their love for Vogue magazine and pop divas). This project has brought together the award winning talents of Stewart Main and Peter Wells (Desperate Remedies), and has itself won accolades at festivals in London, Italy, Canada and Australia.

results.title: One of the family
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens, Derrick Knight and Derrick Knight and Partners
results.brief_description: An assessment of handicapped children which concludes that the frustration of the child is usually less than that of the parents; but with understanding, both parents and children alike can come to terms with their problems.
